general

Class SoundPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • general.SoundPlayer

  • public class SoundPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains static methods for playing a sound synchronously or asynchronously.
    Can also be instantiated to get an object to control the sound after it has started playing. All sound played using an object will be played asynchronously.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream audioStream
      The AudioInputStream the clip is being played from.
      private static int BUFFER_SIZE
      Used to control how much data is read at once by playSound
      private javax.sound.sampled.Clip clip
      The Clip currently being played.
      private java.lang.String filename
      The location of the sound file within resources/sound/.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SoundPlayer

        public SoundPlayer(java.lang.String fileName)
        Creates a new SoundPlayer.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The location of the sound file within resources/sound/.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fileName refers to a file outside of resources/sound/.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Used to test features of this class.
        Parameters:
        args - Unused

      • playSound

        public static void playSound(java.lang.String filename)
        Plays a sound synchronously, not returning until it has finished.
        Parameters:
        filename - The location of the sound file within resources/sound/.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if filename refers to a file outside of resources/sound/.

      • playSoundAsync

        public static void playSoundAsync(java.lang.String filename)
        Plays a sound asynchronously, returning as soon as it has been loaded. This means that the program can end before the sound is finished, in which case the sound will stop playing.
        Parameters:
        filename - The location of the sound file within resources/sound/.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if filename refers to a file outside of resources/sound/.

      • setFileName

        public boolean setFileName(java.lang.String newFileName)
        Opens the music file at newFileName and prepares it for playing.
        Parameters:
        newFileName - The location of the sound file within resources/sound/.
        Returns:
        true if the file was successfully opened, false if there was an error.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if newFileName refers to a file outside of resources/sound/.

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Tells whether or not the Clip is open. As long as close() has not been called, this should return true.
        Returns:
        whether or not the Clip is open.

      • open

        public void open()
        Opens the Clip so that it can be played. This should already be done by the constructor and setFileName(String), so this should only be used if close() has been called.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the Clip, freeing up memory. This should be called when this object is no longer needed to prevent a memory leak.

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        Gets whether or not this object is currently playing sound.
        Returns:
        whether or not this object is playing.

      • play

        public void play()
        Plays this sound a single time.

      • play

        public void play(int times)
        Plays this sound multiple times.
        Parameters:
        times - The number of times to play this sound.

      • loop

        public void loop()
        Loops this sound indefinitely.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Temporarily pauses the sound playback, keeping it at the same position for when it is played again.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the sound playback and resets it to the beginning.
